intro: Phyllolepidum rupestre, commonly known as the rock phyllolepidum, is a small, herbaceous plant native to rocky and arid environments. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and arranged in a basal rosette, adapted to conserve water in harsh conditions. Phyllolepidum rupestre is often found growing on limestone or sandy soils, thriving in well-drained, sun-exposed areas.
